conclusion: To determine the height H at which the fire extinguishing projectile hits the high-rise building, we need to analyze the projectile motion.
The initial velocity v0 is given as 50 m/s at an angle θ = 53°.
Horizontal component of velocity: v0x = v0 cos θ = 50 × 0.6 = 30 m/s
Vertical component of velocity: v0y = v0 sin θ = 50 × 0.8 = 40 m/s
The horizontal distance L is 60 m.
The vertical position y at time t is given by y = v0y × t - (1/2) g t²

premise: The height H at which the projectile hits the building is the vertical position y calculated above
